metadata.title: CVE-2024-3596 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
RADIUS Protocol under RFC 2865 is susceptible to forgery attacks by a localattacker who can modify any valid Response (Access-Accept, Access-Reject,or Access-Challenge) to any other response using a chosen-prefix collisionattack against MD5 Response Authenticator signature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3596` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-common - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-config - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-dhcp - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-iodbc - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-krb5 - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-ldap - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-memcached - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-mysql - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-postgresql - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-python3 - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-redis - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-rest - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-utils - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
freeradius-yubikey - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
libfreeradius3 - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3.3').
